title: Stat Block / KPI Display
description: Stat blocks are used to display key metrics or Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in a clear and prominent way.

overview.title: Overview of Stat Blocks
overview.description: Stat blocks, or KPI displays, provide a quick snapshot of important data. They typically combine a label, a large numerical value, and sometimes an icon for easy visual identification. They are commonly used in dashboards.

html.title: HTML Structure
html.description: The HTML is straightforward, usually a container `<div>` with elements for an icon, a label (title), and the primary data value. Flexbox is used for alignment.

css.title: CSS Styling
css.description: Styling focuses on making the key value stand out with a large font size and bold weight. Color and spacing are used to create a clear visual hierarchy between the label, value, and icon.

js.title: JavaScript Logic
js.description: For a static display, no JavaScript is required. In a real-world application, JavaScript would be used to fetch and update the numerical value dynamically from a data source.

quiz.title: Stat Block Quiz
quiz.description: Test your knowledge on stat blocks.

questions.question: What is the most important design goal for a stat block?
answers: To be as colorful as possible
To clearly and quickly communicate a key piece of data
To include as much text as possible
questions.answer: To clearly and quickly communicate a key piece of data
